(The initial cost of each technology is scaled as 100 on the graph)
content.question: Which of the following is best supported by the information shown on the graph?

choices.label: The cost of all technologies declined more rapidly in the first half of the twentieth century than it did in the second half of the century.
The cost of electronic technologies declined less rapidly than the cost of nonelectronic technologies.
The cost of all technologies declined by more than 50% within ten years of their introduction.
The cost of technologies that rely on the use of petroleum declined less rapidly than the cost of technologies that do not rely on the use of petroleum.

content.answer: The cost of technologies that rely on the use of petroleum declined less rapidly than the cost of technologies that do not rely on the use of petroleum.
